Rule.Name: Ensure 'Maximum number of error log files' is set to 12 or greater
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'Maximum number of error log files' is set to a value less than '12'.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set the 'Maximum number of error log files' to '12' or greater.
Rule.Correction: EXEC sp_configure 'show advanced options', 1; RECONFIGURE; EXEC sp_configure 'max error logs', 12; RECONFIGURE;
Rule.Verification: SELECT value_in_use FROM sys.configurations WHERE name = 'max error logs';

Rule.Name: Ensure 'Default Trace Enabled' is set to 1
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'Default Trace Enabled' server configuration option is set to '0'.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure 'Default Trace Enabled' is set to '1'.
Rule.Correction: EXEC sp_configure 'show advanced options', 1; RECONFIGURE; EXEC sp_configure 'default trace enabled', 1; RECONFIGURE;
Rule.Verification: SELECT value_in_use FROM sys.configurations WHERE name = 'default trace enabled';

Rule.Name: Ensure 'Login Auditing' is set to capture 'Failed Logins'
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'Login Auditing' setting is not set to 'Failed Logins'.
Rule.Correction: EXEC sp_configure 'show advanced options', 1; RECONFIGURE; EXEC sp_configure 'login auditing', 2; RECONFIGURE;
Rule.Verification: SELECT value_in_use FROM sys.configurations WHERE name = 'login auditing';

Rule.Name: Ensure 'SQL Server Audit' is configured to capture both Failed and Successful Logins
Rule.NonCompliantComment: 'SQL Server Audit' is not configured to capture both 'Failed' and 'Successful Logins'.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Configure 'SQL Server Audit' to capture both 'Failed' and 'Successful Logins'. Command: CREATE SERVER AUDIT [ServerAudit] TO FILE (FILEPATH = 'C:\\SQLAudit\\', MAXSIZE = 1 GB); CREATE SERVER AUDIT SPECIFICATION [LoginAudit] FOR SERVER AUDIT [ServerAudit] WITH (STATE = ON) ADD (FAILED_LOGIN_GROUP), ADD (SUCCESSFUL_LOGIN_GROUP);
